review: If you are looking for a cheap and easy way to get netflix or hulu or any of the other supported apps from your phone, ipad, computer, etc. onto your TV then I would highly recommend this.  The only issue I have had is poor connection when trying to cast a Google Chrome browser tab.  The device wasn't able to play Pandora consistently.  Still a great device for the money.
author: Denver Lyons

review: There is good news and bad news here.  The bad news is that I returned the first unit because it simply didn't work.  After completing the initial setup (and calling Google for additional support), I couldn't make the final connection that would show what was on my computer on my tv screen. I returned my first Chromecast to Amazon for a full refund.In the meantime, I had already replaced the unit at another retail due to a 20% sale instore.  This time it did work, but I was able to see the upsides and downsides.  The first thing I did was to play a movie on Netflix -- was pretty impressed with the performance (I watched the movie almost straight through, not much fast forwarding and rewinding), then I listened to some music on Pandora.  In comparison to the Roku that I had before, the interface was not as nice, and also when I started to do my usual multi-tasking on the computer, it would affect the playback of the music, dragging out the words so that I had to stop using the computer for anything else.  Lastly, I tried to stream Spotify, it would work for a few songs, and then it would just stop.  I think essentially that Spotify is not compatible with the Chromecast, but i gave it a shot.Overall, not perfect, but not a big investment either.  Three stars!
author: Kara Park

review: We like this, it allows any device to broadcast via our WiFi directly to the TV where it is plugged in.However they ate still adding programs and video protocols to work with it, so check on Google to ensure your planned program works with Chrome Cast.
